419-413 East 46th Street, north side, east of First Avenue.

March 20, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, from another angle.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

(1)
First Avenue, east side, from 46th to 48th Streets, showing a filling and service station from 46th to 47th Streets, where nine old five-story tenement houses, 826-42 First Avenue, used to stand. Behind the service station are old buildings belonging to Wilson & Company, packers; part of the Wilson slaughter house is shown on the S.E. corner of 46th Street.
July 3, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same. First Avenue at N.E. corner of 46th Street. Many filling stations and garages on First Avenue in the 1920's.
July 3rd, 1934

P.L.Sperr,

(3)The same, showing East Side of First Avenue, 45th to 46th Street.

September 28th, 1940

P.L.Sperr,

46th Street west from, but not including, First Avenue.

July 3, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

First Avenue, east side, north across East 46th Street. In the foreground is a semi-open frontage extending from 46th to 47th Street's. Note the meat smoking house to the rear of same. The Beekman Towers (left) dominates this locale.

July 23, 1939
September 28, 1940

P. L. Sperr

First Avenue, east side, north across East 46th Street. In the foreground is a semi-open frontage extending from 46th to 47th Street's. Note the meat smoking house to the rear of same. The Beekman Towers (left) dominates this locale.

July 23, 1939
